intro: Senecio stirthii, commonly known as the Stirt's groundsel, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a daisy-like pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
